FuncDef: The reset dhcpv6 chasten-user command clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections.
CLIs: reset dhcpv6 chasten-user slot <slot-id> [ mac-address <mac-address> [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-num> | <interface-name> } [ pe-vlan <pe-vlan> [ ce-vlan <ce-vlan> ] ] ] ] [ statistics ]

ParaDef.Info:
Clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections with a specified MAC address.
The value is in H-H-H format, where H can be one to four hexadecimal digits. It cannot be a broadcast or multicast MAC address.

Clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections with a specified interface.
-

Clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections with a specified interface.
-

Clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections with a specified outer VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections with a specified inner VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Clears statistics about limited DHCPv6 user connections.If statistics is not specified in the reset dhcpv6 chasten-user command, the command clears a user's suppression entries on a specified board. After the command is run, the system stops suppressing the user. If statistics is specified in the reset dhcpv6 chasten-user command, the command clears statistics about limited DHCPv6 user connections.
-

Clears information about limited DHCPv6 user connections on a specified board.
-

ExtraInfo:
In scenarios of restricted DHCPv6 user access, run the reset dhcpv6 chasten-user command to clear information about restricted DHCPv6 user connections.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
